intro: Lamprococcus brachycaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed lamprococcus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
